Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 09:07PM worktowin wrote: OK Team, I think your prayers helped a lot!  The doctor called today and said that it is breast cancer, but that it is hormone receptive.  23 years ago it was not, but from what I (a 37 year old male that understands numbers better than medicine) can understand, this is about as good as we could have hoped for... the oncololgist has prescribed 2 oral medications (I will update when I know what they are) but was very reassuring that this would help control and contain the spread and symptoms.  He mentioned that pain in the bones would be treated with radiation if it continues or worsens.  Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Posts.Content: worktowin wrote: 23 years ago my mom (now 70) had breast cancer, a very small tumor which had cells which had spread to several lymph nodes.  The breast was removed and she had a year of chemo.  Recently a number of scans (PET, MRI, CT) show "hot spots" in the lung, chest lymph, spine, femur, and hip.  This week she had a biopsy of the spine, and the results will be coming in next week... at which point I assume that treatment options and a prognosis will be given.  Can any of you provide any feedback on experience with a similar situation? She is on Xanax right now to control the anxiety of waiting nearly 8 weeks since the first bad test result and is sort of out of it.  Are antidepressents a good idea as a substitute?  All ideas are welcome!  Please keep my family in your thoughts... we just cannot believe that this horrible monster has (likely) returned after so long of a time.
